intro: Gaultheria lorentzii, commonly known as the Lorentz's wintergreen, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants such as blueberries and heathers. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Gaultheria lorentzii produces small, bright red berries that are edible and have a spicy, peppery flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
